abstract: The plan, involving a new organization to manage the money, was made by the Facebook chief executive in an open letter to his newborn daughter, Max.
snippet: The plan, involving a new organization to manage the money, was made by the Facebook chief executive in an open letter to his newborn daughter, Max.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Mark Zuckerberg, the co-founder and chief executive of Facebook, announced on Tuesday that he and his wife would give 99 percent of their Facebook shares “during our lives” — holdings currently worth more than $45 billion — to charitable purposes.

headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg Vows to Donate 99% of His Facebook Shares for Charity
headline.print_headline: Facebook Chief Vows to Donate 99% of His Shares for Charity

byline.original: By Vindu Goel and Nick Wingfield
